Package pr1.helper.repository

Class MixedNumberList

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<MixedNumber>
          • pr1.helper.repository.MixedNumberList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<MixedNumber>, java.util.Collection<MixedNumber>, java.util.List<MixedNumber>, java.util.RandomAccess
    public class MixedNumberList
extends java.util.ArrayList<MixedNumber>
    A specialized list for storing and analyzing MixedNumber instances.

    This class extends ArrayList to provide utility methods that operate on the collection as a whole, such as determining the maximum numeric amount, the number of digits in that maximum amount, or the highest precision among all contained MixedNumber objects.

    Since:
    2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Benjamin Wagner
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • MixedNumberList

        public MixedNumberList()

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxAmount

        public double getMaxAmount()
        Returns the largest numeric amount among all MixedNumber elements in this list.

        If the list is empty, this method returns 0.0.

        Returns:
        the maximum amount as a double, or 0.0 if the list is empty

      • getMaxAmountLength

        public int getMaxAmountLength()
        Returns the number of digits in the integer part of the largest amount present in this list.

        The value is derived by truncating the result of getMaxAmount() to an integer and converting it to a string to count its length. If the maximum amount is less than 1 (e.g., 0.5), this method returns 1, since (int) 0.5 == 0 and "0".length() == 1.

        Returns:
        the number of digits in the integer portion of the maximum amount

      • getMaxPrecision

        public int getMaxPrecision()
        Returns the highest precision (i.e., number of decimal places) found among all MixedNumber elements in this list.

        If the list is empty, this method returns 0.

        Returns:
        the maximum precision as an int, or 0 if the list is empty
